revised_title: Observations and Analysis of Russian Artificial Earth Satellites
tldr: This article discusses the observations and analysis of Russian artificial earth satellites, focusing on the various methods used to track and study them, including radio interferometers, Doppler recorders, direction-finding, and field-strength measuring equipment. The article highlights the valuable role these satellites played in understanding the ionosphere and the potential for continuous observations of atmospheric, solar, and interplanetary phenomena.
